comments.commentBody: The loss to Denver is without a doubt the most despicable and devastating loss in Big Mouth Ryan's 2 plus years as HC but I saw this one coming a mile (no pun intended) away since the Jets problems are systemic and foundational: a weakened offensive line, no pass rush, no feature running back, a complete inability to THROW THE BALL VERTICALLY, poor clock managment, conservative, lame play calling and the overall inability of the defense to make key stops in a critical situations. The sad but true fact is the Jets are a pedestrian to below average football team with no identity, no real skill position stars and it will take a complete re-assessment of what needs to be upgraded in these areas for the Jets to contend for a Super Bowl in the coming years.

"And in the end, Ryan’s answer is that we need strong economic growth, the kind that we get by cutting taxes on the rich."

I'm just surprised the Republicans haven't yet claimed that a lower top marginal tax rate would cure cancer.

Saving that argument for the general election, I guess.

Valentine has little to gain and a lot to lose if he takes the Boston job - even winning the World Series would be no big deal since Francona had won it twice in ending "the Curse."

I think he would have been better suited for the Cubs managerial opening, getting the Cubs to the World Series would make him a city-wide hero.

It seems that Newt Gingrich, to his advantage, has set himself apart from other candidates, whose strong backing comes from the Evangelical Christians. He is a man of many words. Yet some of the words can be inflammatory and dangerous.

It is the words spoken by Gingrich about the Arab World.

With a broad brush, Gingrich has tarnished the Arab Spring...millions of good Arab people seeking freedom from oppression, with a charge of anti-Christian leanings. Citing a Church burning in Egypt...depletion of the number of Christians in Muslim countries...does not equate the Arab Spring to an anti-Christian movement.

It is the Newt Gingrich way of rising in the polling data to a front runner status in some polls.

Even the born-again Christian, Rick Perry never went that far...condemning Muslims.

Much like Frank Graham (son of Billy Graham) Newt Gingrich must be considered radical when assessing the Islamic religion. (Frank Graham has labeled Islam, not a true religion). It is a heavy dose of intolerance and a lack of respect for others in the world...combined with an attempt to buy support and votes from the good Christian people in our country.

Words cannot describe a man that would do such a thing...on the other hand one could call it evil.

Politics and religion are a combustible mix...surely if Gingrich ever became president...he would not fight (a holy war) for religious liberties around the world...indeed, he said just that.

Some of the many words by Newt Gingrich.

I am tired of very little of substance getting done.  I would propose the Occupy Wallstreet protesters and the American public take up the position of voting all incumbents out of their current posts.  This would send the strong message that the time for action is now and the days of the career politician are over.  This would certainly wrangle the some of the power away from the lobbyists and the political parties.

@6 - wins my vote for comment of the year!

@3 - your group of death overestimates france, and your group of ease underestimates italy

This is a bunch of Eriteans who are proud of their country and don't want their nation to lose face. But the truth is Isaias Afewerki is running a repressive regime with no independent press, arbitrary arrests and executions, and no political rights. Female genital mutilation is common and the nation is incredibly poor. If that's what Eriteans are satisfied with, then so be it, but regardless of one's belief, it is clear that the country is incredibly repressive and defending the regime through a human rights point of view certainly fails.

Huge congratulations must go to Antigua and Barbuda. They have done so well to get this far. I hope that they hold their own and don't get humiliated by the US or the other teams in the group. Considering the team manager is also the manager of the only full time club side it is an amazing achievement. They are higher in the Fifa rankings then world cup surprise team New Zealand. I wrote about in my own blog but thought id big them up! http://www.resultsbasedbusiness.co.uk/2011/11/road-to-world-cup-antigua-...

Best part of tonight's efforts - the Steve McQueen video - I agree with wsbdev @1 - ENSTEEL - obscure, misspelled MCGuIRE. Favorite clues - 28A. and 63A and 2D,  So many of the clues seemed obscure to me that I worked with the letters, searching for probable and plausible words and then looking at the clues. All in all - a very difficult challenge for me.
Perry has a tank to think for him. It's an old Sherman tank from WWII he got at an army surplus store. What was the dog's name?

I painfully worked my way through the entire 5 pages of comments, and my conclusion is the same as that which occurred to me after the first dozen individual comments: There certainly are a lot of folks around who fail basic critical thinking.

It doesn't matter how sweet streaming or cached video may look on the new Nook, it is NOT actually HD. If B&N wishes to brag about the spectacular quality of the video the Nook displays, have at it. But promoting a specific TECHNICAL specification that the device is simply incapable of executing is inexcusable.

I have both a Fire and an iPad 2, and I compared the quality of streaming video of the same movie (Lethal Weapon IV) on both. I was more impressed by the movie as displayed on my iPad, but I also feel that this preference is mostly due to the significantly larger screen size, which improves the overall experience, rather than the true image quality displayed.

On the other hand my Fire fits neatly into my inside jacket breast pocket, while my iPad requires either a carry bag or a filled hand that can't be used for other tasks, so it's all a matter of what fits best for a particular purpose. On a trip of any duration I'll generally take the iPad, but for crosstown trips, lunch meetings, or that chance to hibernate in the bathroom while escaping the family, I'll grab the Kindle.

Regardless of what the Nook offers as a personal, portable device, blatantly exaggerating the hardware specs is more than enough for me to slam the purchasing door closed.
It's an un-seaworthy ship which a loose lip will sink. Way to go, Joe. I'm proud of you. Now about that case of necrotizing fascistitis that has seized Washington...

Vilify, crucify, all those who try to qualify; the process is so daunting, to run is hard to justify.Leave no stone unturned-why not pick them up and throw them? No wonder all the good guys bolt before we get to know them!

Scott Brown won the election to replace Ted Kennedy purely by default. His Democratic opponent was Attorney General Martha Coakley who ran one of the worst campaigns in Massachusetts history. She apparently though that she was a sure winner and ran a very unimpressive campaign.
I am a senior living on very modest savings and social security and as soon I heard that Elizabeth Warren was considering running, I immediately sent a contribution and have continued to send regular contributions to her campaign. As much as I hate receiving phone solicitations, I am committed to working on her campaign ringing doorbells and making phone calls and doing anything needed to help her become the junior senator from this state. I was a small time capitalist for over thirty years as a retailer in Manhattan until high rents and competition put me out of business. I believe in our free enterprise system having been a part of it but I believe in social and equitable justice. The financial institutions have run free and relatively unfettered for their own benefit and it is time I and folks like me are represented by a senator who can empathize with my needs.
Despite Wall Street's efforts to the contrary, I'm fairly confident that Elizabeth Warren will wipe the floor with Scott Brown come 2012.
I'm counting the days til I can vote against Scott Brown and his dirty money.  He doesn't represent the people of this state and never did.

Scott Brown works only for the 1%. Dump him as soon as possible. Mrs. Warren is my pick to replace Obama in 2016. She works for the 99%. This isn't rocket science. Scott Brown is a tool of the bad guys. Let him Occupy the losers seat in 2012!
Gee, I keep forgetting to make a donation to Elizabeth Warren. Thanks to Scott Brown's campaign for reminding me why, when, how and right now.

"People want to help him, and I think she certainly has her supporters who are going to help her."

*This* supporter is going to help her right now.

Commentor #35.  You wish Ms. Warren was running against someone else other than Scott Brown.  I feel the same way.  I wish she was running against President Obama.  Brown may have received a great deal of Wall Street money, but not as much as our president.

Helping Elizabeth Warren defeat Brown and his Wall Street buddies is something we should all do; if you think things are bad now, just imagine what it would be like with a Republican Senate. I may not live on a Connecticut estate, but making a contribution to defeat Brown is something I plan to do.
Brown vs. Warren is class warfare put to a vote. In this battle, I'm a proud foot soldier for Warren.

Crossroads GPS began a half-million dollar advertising campaign seeking to tie Ms. Warren to the anti-Wall Street protesters in New York and around the country. “Elizabeth Warren sides with extreme left protests,” the ad charges, where “protesters attack police, do drugs, and trash public parks.”

So we can infer that Brown approves of lies being employed to run people down. That's what I thought. And it is one of the reasons this country desperately needs people like Elizabeth Warren in the senate. To raise the integrity bar in the institution. Wall Street never aware of the concept of integrity is a lost cause thus the need for regulation in the form of felony charges for fraud, i.e.. I picked these loser securities to sell to you so that when they tank I'l make a lot of money because right after you bought them I bet against them. What Wall Street believes in, cheating people's retirement funds.

I will be sending my generous contribution to Warrens's campaign toot sweet.

I expect Massachusetts voters will turn out in force next time.

Just saying that "tax hikes" are "job killing" doesn't make that true no matter how many times it is repeated, and in fact there are times -- like now -- when "tax hikes" are the best way to create jobs: by hiring back fired teachers, resuming maintenance on public parks, repairing infrastructure, and hiring personnel to provide any number of necessary services that have been cut to the bone.

I am so sick of hearing Republicans' fantasies about economics, politics, and government I wish they would all just wake up and smell the coffee.

Who among us can reasonably believe that in twenty-five or in two hundred and fifty years the claim to being an "exceptional" country (among the hundreds of countries on earth) can stand serious scrutiny? We're here, all of us, just trying to make sense of life, struggling to raise our children, and (collectively) hoping for a better tomorrow. In another article in the NYT today there was a question of whether our presidential candidates need to take a test to become president. I think it might be more productive and germane to administer a test to us, our voters. Sure, it's heresy, but an informed and educated electorate is the only way to tackle the future intelligently.

Exceptionalism is only shorthand for preserving and glorifying the past; it has nothing to do with how we'll govern in 2036.

The sooner the Republicans and their minions put aside raw nationalism the sooner we'll be able to focus on reality: resource management, job creation, environmental protection and quality of life issues.

Bernard Edmonds
